Package org.alindner.cish.lang

Class Parameter

java.lang.Object
org.alindner.cish.lang.Parameter
public class Parameter
extends java.lang.Object
This class controls the access to the parameter the user submits to the script
Since:
0.3.2
Author:
alindner

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Parameter.Option
    represents a option which a value that gets checked to the parameter.
    static interface  Parameter.ParameterLambda
    a simple interface for lambda purpose

    • getScript

      public static CiFile getScript()
      get the script which gets executed
      Returns:

    • getCish

      Returns:
      cish interpreter

    • when

      public static void when​(java.lang.String parameter, Parameter.Option... options)
      The given parameters value will be check to each given option. If an option matches it's lambda method will be executed.

      In this context parameter means extendedParams

      Parameters:
      parameter - parameter name
      options - the options
      See Also:
      extendedParams

    • options

      public static Parameter.Option options​(java.lang.String value, Parameter.ParameterLambda lambda)
      create a new Parameter.Option
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the parameter which get checked for equality
      lambda - the lambda method which gets executed
      Returns:
      a new Parameter.Option
      See Also:
      Parameter.Option

    • when

      public static void when​(java.lang.String simpleParameter, Parameter.ParameterLambda lambda)
      if the given parameter was set it executes the given lambda.

      In this context parameter means params

      Parameters:
      simpleParameter - parameter name
      lambda - lambda which gets executed
      See Also:
      params

    • when

      public static void when​(java.lang.String parameter, java.lang.String value, Parameter.ParameterLambda lambda)
      if the given parameter equals the given value it executes the given lambda.

      In this context parameter means extendedParams

      Parameters:
      parameter - parameter name
      value - parameter value
      lambda - lambda which gets executed
      See Also:
      extendedParams

    • get

      public static java.lang.String get​(java.lang.Integer i)
      get a parameter
      Parameters:
      i - index, starting at 0
      Returns:
      parameter
